May the golden elixir, divine nectar, and jade fluid enter our bodies, accompanied by divine maidens to attend and guard us on left and right. May the Nine Heavens’ Prime Ministers erase our names from the registers of death and inscribe them in the Three Heavens’ records of life, granting us boundless existence with heaven and earth. May we traverse the world, our names inscribed upon the sacred mountains of the Six Directions. May we move freely among people, extending our years and increasing our longevity, warding off the five weapons, quenching fires and floods, dispelling official calumnies, illnesses, deaths, and misfortunes. May tigers, wolves, and fierce beasts, venomous creatures, vengeful foes, thieves, and bandits be submerged in the Yellow Abyss, buried ten thousand fathoms deep, never to emerge or spread falsehoods.

Should any talisman masters, Daoist priests, or miscellaneous spirits of the Six Heavens’ former breath, or those who feast upon ghosts and spirits, attempt to intrude or conceal themselves, may the myriad spirits assist and escort us as we traverse the world. May the earthly deities and celestial spirits descend in every place we tread, manifesting the verification of the immortal Dao. May we surely achieve embryonic breathing, ingesting and guiding the divine breath, illuminating our inner and outer selves. May clouds course through our bodies, ascending to the Pure Heavens. May the Yellow Emperor and Laozi establish their grace, and may we befriend divine immortals, associating with True Persons. May we soar aloft, ascending to replenish the ranks of the Heavenly Immortals, riding clouds and driving dragons to pay homage to the Dao Lord. May we never age unto death, our luminosity equaling that of the sun and moon. May we fly and transcend, concealing or revealing ourselves at will, floating upon the wheel of existence. May our seven generations of parents, extending to the hundred million ancestors of myriad lineages, all ascend to the Three Heavens and be appointed to the ranks of immortal officials.

We humbly implore the Supreme Venerable, the Boundless Supreme Unity Lord, to bestow mercy and accept our plea.

---

**The Red Writs of the Three Covenants to be Conferred After the Breaking of the Pacts**
**Rites of the Three Covenants of the Supreme Unity and Yellow Simplicity**

We reverently present the Yellow Simplicity and Cinnabar Covenant, addressing all disciples:

We, [Name] and others, affirm our allegiance to the Gate of Boundless Purity of the Supreme Clarity and Supreme Unity, where the True One and the Five Qi, the Supreme Unity and the Nine Palaces, are fully perfected, thereby attaining immortal deliverance. The Supreme Venerable, upon ascending the Heavenly Summit of Kunlun and entering the Seven Treasures Abbey, summoned the Celestial Master Zhang Daoling and declared:

“Our Dao emerged from Non-Being, prior to the Great Beginning, unoriginated and yet nowhere unaccomplished. Formerly, upon this abbey, I received the wondrous Dharma. Through keen wisdom and focused devotion, I practiced and attained subtlety, penetrating the mysteries in pursuit of the Dao. None who ascend as immortals bear the name of negligence. Those who uphold the Dao of the Yellow Emperor and Laozi must master the secrets of life and death, ever fearing the Dharma and revering the precepts. Within the Gate of Life, there is but one path to life and nine paths to death. Tested by the Great Deliverance, one must ever tremble as if treading upon ice and blades, ever wary of poison lest it harm the self. Be humble and yielding, speak modestly, and lower oneself before others. Practice with diligence and endure hardship, never failing in filial piety and reverence. After receiving the precepts, uphold the Dharma and observe the prohibitions, never transgressing the numerical methods of the Nine and the One—the ultimate path of life.”

The Celestial Master bowed twice, pledged to uphold the covenant, and ascended to the rank of Celestial Master. Later, he transmitted the teachings to Wang Chang, Zhao Sheng, the Three Ladies of Luoyang, and the Three Dukes, all of whom attained ascension in broad daylight. The altar rites are as follows.

---

We reverently invoke the covenant and oath, presenting them to the Three Officials. We, [Name] and others, who receive this covenant, swear by heaven and earth as our witness, by the sun and moon as our bond, and call upon our three generations of ancestors, five lineages of forebears, seven generations of parents, and ourselves to bear witness. We shall not lightly transmit or divulge the altar precepts, which may be taught to three persons over nine years. Should no worthy recipient exist in the world, we shall report to the Three Officials, open the original covenant, seal the precepts and matters therein, and conceal them within a mountain’s stone chamber, never violating the covenant.

Should we uphold this pact, our seven generations of parents shall ascend to the Mysterious Palace, receive blessings from the Heavenly Officials, and attain immortal deliverance, their fortune flowing through ten thousand generations, their descendants forever honored. Should we recklessly transmit these teachings to the unworthy, our seven generations of parents shall descend to endure the trials of the Wind Blade, our bodies submerged in the River of Accumulated Nights, our misfortunes flowing through ten thousand generations, our descendants suffering eternal torment, drinking blood and consuming cinnabar, their divine hearts laid bare.

We open the seals of the Three Officials, witnessed by the sun and moon, heard by heaven and earth. After this covenant is sworn, the Controller of Destinies shall erase our names from the registers of death and inscribe them in the records of life. The Heavenly Officials shall register our immortal names, the Earthly Officials shall remove our death records, and the Water Officials shall sever our karmic trials. The Generals and Officers of the Three Officials’ Summoning Courts, along with the generals and officers we bear, shall protect our mortal bodies and ensure our immortal deliverance.

Should our past karma or unresolved grievances prevent immediate ascension, we must undergo temporary corpse liberation, passing through the Great Yin. Having ascended the altar and undergone the Great Deliverance, our sins shall be eradicated, our blessings born, and our ascent assured. The Twenty-Four Spirits of the Divine Chamber and Blessed Hall shall guard our forms, preventing the dispersal of our souls and the decay of our flesh and bones. After twenty-four years, our forms shall transform and emerge. Though our karmic debts demand death, we shall transcend and revive, our withered bones receiving immortality. Though submerged or concealed, we shall be unbound and unrestrained—such is the power of ascending the altar and swearing the Three Officials’ covenant, transcending kalpas and bestowing the fortune of deliverance from death.

We must cultivate ourselves with clarity and caution, never daring to violate this pact.

---

We reverently proclaim the covenant, addressing all disciples who share this altar and witness together:

Should our master or parents encounter calamity, we shall collectively aid them. Should they suffer unjust imprisonment, we shall exhaust all means to rescue and deliver them swiftly, never abandoning them lightly or betraying the covenant. Should any fail to respond to such pleas for help, the afflicted shall invoke the covenant and beseech the spirits for deliverance. Those who violate the covenant shall endure trials, while those who uphold it shall receive blessings.

Should we face calamity in perilous places, we shall, whether our master lives or has passed, silently pray at night, baring our cinnabar hearts to seek deliverance. Should we remain unrelieved, we shall report to the spirits of the luminous realm, who shall know our merit and transgression. The Generals and Officers of the Covenant, along with the Three Officials of the Altar, shall guard and protect us, ensuring our safety. We must only reverently uphold the covenant and never violate our oaths, thereby attaining immortal deliverance. The Guardian Generals and Officers shall record our merits and transgressions, while the Three Officials of the Altar shall adjudicate our sins and blessings. We must bear witness with clarity and caution.

Once the matters presented are concluded, may the immortal officials, officers, and soldiers depart, each returning to their palaces, governing the Five Palaces and Six Treasuries, resuming their posts and duties. On the appointed day, they shall be summoned forth again. Beat the drum twice, sound the three qi-chants, and conclude.

**Ritual for the Transmission of the Three Covenants of the Great One**

Face east and strike the teeth twenty-four times. Reverently summon forth the divine immortals within the servant’s body: the Directing Envoy of the Orthodox Unity Divine Officials, the Functionaries of Yin and Yang, the Radiant Light Envoys of Qi-Circulation, the Left and Right Official Envoys, the Yin-Yang Divine Clerks of the Qi-Chariot, the Scarlet Talisman Clerks, the Courier Riders of the Steadfast Wind, the Flying Dragon Riders, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the Scarlet Flying Immortal Youths—twenty-four of each. Let those who emerge be clad in solemn attire, arrayed in full regalia. Reverently notify the True Officials of Qi-Registration in such-and-such prefecture, county, and village; the Inspecting and Summoning Four Lords and their officers; the local deities of the communities and hamlets; the Earth Spirits; the supervisory divine immortals of the eight directions; and all officials in their true ranks, bound by the indissoluble contract of the Heavenly Master, the Great One’s Qi, the Boundless Vajra, and the Golden Tablet. The Master of the Sacred Peak, your servant [name], bows twice and respectfully memorializes the Supreme Boundless Dao, the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao; the Lords and Elders; the Great One Emperor Lord; the Heavenly Emperor Lord; the August Great Dao; the Heavenly Master; the Three Masters; the Great One Divine Immortals; the True Statutes of the Jade Registers; the Envoys of Transmission Rituals; and the Directors of Flying Immortal Affairs.

Your servant, through ten thousand kalpas of karmic affinity, has fortuitously encountered the Great Law. By fortunate circumstance, I met the Great Cavern Dharma Master, the Perfected One [name], who transmitted to me the Great Covenant of the Altar, the oaths of life and death, the Dao of ascension, the essential secrets of the Mysterious Origin, and the contracts of the host of Perfected Ones. By the good fortune of past lives’ awakened nature, I have received the Dharma for many years. Though I have yet to perceive the hidden or witness the unseen, to sit in stillness or stand in dissolution, I humbly hope for the descent of the Mysterious, that I may bear its statutes in my person. In accordance with the statutes, I transmit it to worthy successors.

In such-and-such prefecture, county, and village, [name], aged [number] years, previously received the Yellow Register Covenant and was commanded to uphold the Five Vajra Covenants. Having cultivated qi for many years and mastered the disciplines, he now presents his credentials and sincerity, seeking to receive the Great Secrets of the Three Covenants of the Altar. Witnessing the original methods of my former master, I, together with [name], establish the altar, invoke the Five Emperors as witnesses, divide the gold, break the tablets, and proclaim the cinnabar oath. After [name] receives the Dao, may it forever be his personal treasure. He must not undermine his roots or sever his foundation, revile his master or slander the Dao, reveal essential secrets to the unworthy, or disseminate sacred texts among the worldly. Should he violate this even once, his parents in life and death shall sink into eternal damnation, their sins irredeemable for ten thousand kalpas. Respectfully submitted for your consideration and enactment. Your servant [name], with utmost reverence and trepidation, bows twice.

**Next: Reading of the Tablet**
Read the Yellow Covenant.

**Next: Drawing the One**
Draw the One: with the left hand pointing to Heaven, the right hand drawing on Earth, then the left hand pointing to the Center. The master then declares:
*"Bound by the Heavenly Master of such-and-such district, [name], from the Great Cavern disciple [name], I transmit the Altar Covenant Tablet of the Great One. Now, in accordance with the Dharma, I transmit it to the disciple [name], who receives this covenant. He shall abide by the great oath of the Perfected Master’s altar, never undermining his roots or severing his foundation, reviling his master or slandering the Dao, or revealing the sacred covenant. Should he violate this even once, he shall perish and bear the guilt, sinking into eternal damnation. Above, he invokes the numinous spirits of Heaven; below, he invokes the deities of Earth; and in the center, he swears before the worthy. The Three Numinous Covenants bear witness, and none shall betray their pledge. Together, we draw the One as a token."*

**Next: Tying the Hair**
Make the first knot, declaring: *"The Heaven of Pure Tenuity."*
Make the second knot, declaring: *"The Heaven of Vast Surplus."*
Make the third knot, declaring: *"The Heaven of Great Redness."*
*"By the true emperors of the Three Heavens above, we swear anew, tying our hair at the altar of the covenant, never to betray the sacred pact."*

**Next: Inscribing the Register**
Declare: *"The Great One of the Mysterious Elder, the Barrier Gate."*
Inscribe the center, declaring: *"The Great Supreme Gate of the Great One, the Stone Gate."*

**Next: The Disciple’s Oath over the Cinnabar Water**
*"The male/female Daoist of the Great One, [name], of such-and-such prefecture, county, and village, dares to proclaim to the Cinnabar Water: I, [name], delight in the immortals and revere the sacred, and have come to the Boundless Daoist of the Great One, [name], to receive the Great Tablet of the Three Covenants of the Altar, the Luminous True Great Name, the three hundred sixty diagrams, and the one thousand two hundred oral secrets. As a disciple, I must not betray the master’s Dao, recklessly transmit it to the worldly, or violate the covenant, lest my clan be overthrown and I perish for breaking my oath. Together, we swear by the Cinnabar Water, pointing to Heaven and drawing on Earth to invoke the divine spirits. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes!"*

**Next: The Master’s Command over the Cinnabar Water**
*"The Boundless Daoist of the Great One, [name], dares to proclaim to the Cinnabar Water: In such-and-such prefecture, county, and village, [name] seeks to receive from me the secrets of the Great Tablet of the Three Covenants of the Altar and the Luminous True Great Name. May the myriad divine spirits monitor [name] as a disciple, that he never betray the covenant. Above, the Three Heavens and the Venerable Lord Lao bear witness. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes!"*

**Next: Holding the Cinnabar Water**
The master holds the Cinnabar Water with his left hand, the disciple with his right, and together they sip it three times, the disciple first, then the master.

**Ritual of the Offering Altar**
Prepare five offering trays and five incense burners, with five portions of dates, and face east to sacrifice to the Five Emperors.
Prepare nine offering trays and nine incense burners, with nine portions of dates, and face east to sacrifice to the Nine Lords of the Great One.

*"The Perfected One of the Boundless Great One, the Heavenly Master of such-and-such district, your servant [name], respectfully presents this offering to the Azure Emperor of the East, the Vermilion Emperor of the South, the White Emperor of the West, the Qi Emperor of the North, the Yellow Emperor of the Center, the Great One Emperor Lord, the August Great Dao, and the Jade Emperor of the Grand Clarity. With nine billion myriad riders, they shake Heaven and move Earth, descending upon this sacred peak and imperial altar to partake of this humble offering. May their numinous presence deign to grace the world, and in their compassion for the transgressions and shortcomings of living beings, I humbly beseech their forgiveness and pardon. I bow twice."*

We respectfully invite the Perfected Immortals of the Boundless and Natural, the Primordial Heavenly Emperor and the Supreme Primordial Lord, bearing their names and titles, leading their retinues of chariots and riders, the Five Stars and Five Emperors, the Nine Palaces and Five Marchmounts, the Four Seas, the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance, the Three Rivers and Nine Jiang, the divine armies of immortals, the Great One’s chariot of the single shaft, the horses of the Boundless before, and the true spirit and essence behind. May they attend the Five Emperors’ presence, the immortals’ chariots and riders flanking left and right, banishing all inauspicious omens before and all calamities behind. May the Jade Armillary revolve above our heads and the Northern Dipper tread beneath our feet. May the sun, moon, and Five Stars lead before and follow behind, shaking heaven and moving earth as they descend in perfect order to left and right. Together with your servants [names], may we be received in the Palace of the Three Primordials, becoming lords of the divine immortals and emperors. May our seven generations of ancestors ascend and be delivered, their souls entering the homeland of the Dao, the halls of leisure and joy, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally.

We humbly invoke the boundless grace of the Supreme Venerable Dao, the Most High Mysterious Ancient, the Three Qi Heavenly Emperor Lord. Through the direct envoys of the Two Bureaus, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers, the Upper Right Bureau Messengers, the yin-yang divine writ officials, the chariot-bearing vermilion talisman officers, the刚风 courier post riders, and the memorial-presenting officials—each pair in their station—we, your servants, having received the Three Pacts of the Great One, now prostrate ourselves for three days to offer this petition of gratitude. One scroll of thanksgiving is hereby submitted to the Celestial Bureaus, awaiting your decree. With utmost reverence and awe, we bow our heads and kowtow twice.

*Memorial of Thanksgiving after Three Days.*

**The Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles: Texts and Precepts for Liberation**
*Composed by the Assembly of the Ten Thousand Immortals*

To receive the thirty-six sacred scriptures of the Numinous Treasure without submitting a *huian* is to remain barred from transmission for ten thousand kalpas. Once the *huian* is submitted but the Three Pacts of the Great One—the Golden Perfection of the Altar’s Threefold Alliance—are not fulfilled, the Seven Mysteries shall not depart from Dengdu. How then may one presume to take disciples? Only upon completing the Three Pacts do the Seven Mysteries transcend; life and death become as one with the immortals. Then the *huian* is conferred, and one is ordained as a Master of the Cavernous Mystery.

Should the seven generations of ancestors remain unredeemed or the Three Pacts be broken, to lightly bestow the *huian* is to incur the sins of leaking scriptures and profaning the sacred. By the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, one shall suffer the trial of the Wind Blade; by the Three Pacts’ covenant, the living and the dead shall be liberated, their names inscribed in the heavens. Thus is one ordained as a Master of the Numinous Treasure.

To receive the scriptures of the Numinous Treasure’s liberation without manifesting it to one’s master is to leave the register of death unbroken and one’s name absent from the Jade Texts. Though one may hold the sacred scriptures, they shall never be transmitted, and the Great Dao shall remain sealed—bringing only harm to oneself.
